gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui
Class HidableTabbedPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.HidableTabbedPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class HidableTabbedPane
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A tabbed pane that hides the tabs when there is only one tab. Since JTabbedPane always shows the tabs, we implement a JPanel instead, with two possible Components inside: either the component that would be shown in the first tab, or an actual JTabbedPane with all components and tab titles. We implement a portion of the JTabbedPane protocol, intended to be the most useful methods.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setSelectedIndex

public void setSelectedIndex(int index)
Set the selected tab index. The index must be a valid tab index or -1, which indicates that no tab should be selected (can also be used when there are no tabs in the tabbedpane).

index - the new selected tab index

isTabsShown

public boolean isTabsShown()
Check whether the tabs are shown. We show the tabs whenever the tab count is greater than one.

Returns:
true, if the tabs are shown

addTab

public void addTab(java.lang.String title,
                   java.awt.Component component)
Add a new tab with a textual title and content area component. Show the tabs, if we then have more than one tab.

Parameters:
title - the title for the new tab
component - the component for the content area

removeTabAt

public void removeTabAt(int index)
Remove a tab. Hide the tabs, if we then have only one tab.

Parameters:
index - the index of the tab to remove

showTabs

protected void showTabs()
Show the tabs. Move the first component into the first tab.

hideTabs

protected void hideTabs()
Hide the tabs. Move the first component from the first tab to be the entire content area.
